titles.title: California Indian Land Transfer Act
To provide for the transfer of public lands to certain California Indian Tribes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Lands.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Native American and Insular Affairs.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-767.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 412.

action.text: Mr. Gallegly moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.

bill.summary: 6/13/1996--Introduced. California Indian Land Transfer Act - Transfers all right, title, and interest of the U.S. in and to specified lands to certain California Indian tribes to be held in trust by the U.S. for the benefit of such Indian tribes. Terminates grazing privileges on the lands two years after the date of enactment of this Act.
